description: From Middle English sesonably, equivalent to seasonable +â€Ž -ly.

adverbs.description: seasonably (comparative more seasonably, superlative most seasonably)

entries.meaning: In due season; at an opportune or fitting time.
examples: ...having very long suspended our conference about the freshly mention'd Subject, it was so newly begun when you came in, that we shall scarce need to repeat any thing to acquaint you With what has pass'd betwixt us before your arrival, so that I cannot but look upon it as a fortunate Accident that you should come so seasonably, to be not hearers alone, but we hope Interlocutors at our conference.

entries.meaning: In a manner appropriate to the season.
(chiefly law) Within the appropriate time period during which an action will be legally effective, as prescribed in legislation, a contract, or otherwise.
examples: An action is taken "seasonably" when it is taken at or within the time agreed or if no time is agreed at or within a reasonable time.
